messages.message:
Update here: api-server-app unit tests are still crazy verbose with the -b change. I’m still not entirely sure why the logs get through — it seems to happen only if I run all the tests with discover, but doesn’t happen if i run only a single test, even if that test contains the verbose stuff.

Anyways, I realized the reason we have all these stat errors is the FakeIOFileService is essentially designed (I don’t know if intentionally) to have a failed stat when it’s initialized. I’m creating a PR to remove the log message, since I don’t think FileNotFoundError raised by os.stat is an exception - seems like expected behavior if the file is not there. That greatly reduces the amount of error logs in api-server-apps unit tests!

Now still need to figure out why all those other log messages are still coming through :thinking_face:

Btw Lydia, the FakeIOFileService located in thrift-file-service is getting deprecated.
This is the new (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/shared-utils/py-utils/test-utils/src/py/instabase_test/test_utils/fake_grpc_file_service.py#L29) one that @Victor Zeng helped create and will be gradually replacing the old one.

oh great! hopefully that will clean up a lot of the weirdness with FakeIOFileService. Btw was just reading that tempfile.TemporaryDirectory (https://docs.python.org/3/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.TemporaryDirectory) is the high-level obj with cleanup handled, vs. using the lower-level mkdtemp()
